class map.floor.Floor(floor_data=None)[source]

Represents a single floor in a level with all its entities and terrain.

class map.map.Map(floor)[source]

Represents a game map composed of a grid of tiles, including floors, walls, and exits.

The map is constructed from a ‘floor’ object that provides the grid layout, dimensions, and exit position. The Map class provides functionality for drawing visible tiles based on a camera view, and for querying tile properties such as walls and exit positions. .. attribute:: floor

Floor object.

type:

Floor

__init__(floor)[source]

Initialize the Map object from a floor object.

Parameters:

floor (Floor) – A floor object containing the grid layout, width, height, and exit position information.

draw(screen, camera)[source]

Draw the visible portion of the map to the screen using the camera’s position and size.

Parameters:

  • screen (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw the map tiles on.

  • camera (Camera) – Camera object providing x, y position and visible width and height in tile units.

is_exit(x, y)[source]

Check if the tile at the specified coordinates is the exit.

Parameters:

  • x (int or float) – X coordinate of the tile.

  • y (int or float) – Y coordinate of the tile.

Returns:

True if the tile is the exit or out of bounds, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

is_wall(x, y)[source]

Check if the tile at the specified coordinates is a wall.

Parameters:

  • x (int or float) – X coordinate of the tile.

  • y (int or float) – Y coordinate of the tile.

Returns:

True if the tile is a wall or out of bounds, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

is_wall_area(x, y, width=1.0, height=1.0)[source]

Check if any corner of a rectangular area intersects a wall tile. Useful for collision detection for entities larger than one tile.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X coordinate of the top-left corner of the area.

  • y (float) – Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the area.

  • width (float, optional) – Width of the area in tiles (default 1.0).

  • height (float, optional) – Height of the area in tiles (default 1.0).

Returns:

True if any corner of the area intersects a wall tile, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

on_exit(player, width=1.0, height=1.0)[source]

Check if the player’s bounding box is overlapping any exit tile.

Parameters:

  • player (Player) – The player object, expected to have x and y attributes.

  • width (float, optional) – Width of the player’s bounding box in tiles (default 1.0).

  • height (float, optional) – Height of the player’s bounding box in tiles (default 1.0).

Returns:

True if any corner of the player overlaps an exit tile, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

set_floor(floor)[source]

Set the current floor to the provided floor object and initialize the map grid, width, height, and mark the exit position on the grid.

Parameters:

floor (Floor) – The floor object to use as the current map layout.

class map.MapUtility.MapUtility[source]

Utility class for loading, saving, and managing map files.

static get_level_info(filepath)[source]

Get basic information about a level without fully loading it.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – Path to the JSON file

Return type:

Optional[Dict[str, Any]]

Returns:

Dictionary with level info or None if failed

static list_map_files(directory='maps')[source]

List all JSON map files in directory.

Parameters:

directory (str) – Directory to search for map files

Return type:

List[str]

Returns:

List of filenames (without full path)

static load_level(filepath)[source]

Load level from JSON file.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – Path to the JSON file

Return type:

Optional[Level]

Returns:

Level object or None if loading failed

static save_level(level, filepath)[source]

Save level to JSON file.

Parameters:

  • level (Level) – Level object to save

  • filepath (str) – Path where to save the file

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if successful, False otherwise
